Package com.ggl.jcalendar.view

Class JCalendar

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Dialog
javax.swing.JDialog
com.ggl.jcalendar.view.JCalendar
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class JCalendar
extends javax.swing.JDialog

JCalendar is a Swing JDialog that displays the month as a calendar for the calendar date. The day of the calendar date is highlighted. This dialog is usually created in the ActionListener of a JButton

The user selected date is retrieved as a LocalDate. If the user cancels the JCalendar, the selected date is retrieved as null.

The JCalendar has several optional parameters. You may:

  • Change the panel background color.
  • Change the panel foreground color.
  • Change the calendar day highlight color.
  • Change the font.
  • Change the month names, to accommodate other languages.
  • Change the start day of the week. The default is the DayOfWeek SUNDAY.
  • Change the three letter day of the week names, to accommodate other languages and other start days of the week.
  • Exclude week days from being selected.
  • Set the earliest valid date for selection.
  • Set the latest valid date for selection.

Here's the simplest example of creating a JCalendar. 

 
    JCalendar calendar = new JCalendar(frame, LocalDate.now(), 
            "Transaction Date");
    calendar.start();
    LocalDate selectedDate = calendar.getSelectedDate();
    if (selectedDate != null) {
        ...
    }
Optional parameter method calls would go between the JCalendar instantiation and the start method call.

Here's one example of a "dark" JCalendar: 

 
    JCalendar calendar = new JCalendar(frame, LocalDate.now(), 
            "Transaction Date");
    calendar.setPanelBackGroundColor(Color.BLACK);
    calendar.setPanelForegroundColor(Color.WHITE);
    calendar.setDayHighlightColor(Color.RED);
    calendar.start();
    LocalDate selectedDate = calendar.getSelectedDate();
    if (selectedDate != null) {
        ...
    }

Author:
Gilbert G. Le Blanc - Created 16 July 2021
See Also:
Color, ActionListener, DayOfWeek, LocalDate, JButton, JDialog, JFrame, Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • JCalendar

      public JCalendar​(javax.swing.JFrame frame, java.time.LocalDate calendarDate, java.lang.String title)
      This constructor creates the default JCalendar.
      Parameters:
      frame - - The JFrame for which this JCalendar JDialog is meant.
      calendarDate - - The date for which a calendar of the month and year is displayed. The day of the month is highlighted.
      title - - The title of the JDialog which describes what type of date the user selects.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      This method creates the JCalendar and displays the JDialog.

    • getSelectedDate

      public java.time.LocalDate getSelectedDate()
      This method returns the selected date.
      Returns:
      Selected date or null if JDialog is cancelled.

      This method sets the font.

      setFont in class java.awt.Container

      public void setDaysToExclude​(java.time.DayOfWeek... daysToExclude)
      This method sets the days to exclude from selection.
      Parameters:
      daysToExclude - - One or more DayOfWeek values to exclude from selection.

    • setPanelBackGroundColor

      public void setPanelBackGroundColor​(java.awt.Color panelBackGroundColor)
      This method sets the JCalendar panel background color.
      Parameters:
      panelBackGroundColor - - Panel background color.

    • setPanelForegroundColor

      public void setPanelForegroundColor​(java.awt.Color panelForegroundColor)
      This method sets the JCalendar panel foreground color.
      Parameters:
      panelForeGroundColor - - Panel foreground color.

    • setDayHighlightColor

      public void setDayHighlightColor​(java.awt.Color dayHighlightColor)
      This method sets the JCalendar day highlight color. Setting this color the same as the panel background color effectively removes the day highlighting.
      Parameters:
      dayHighlightColor - - Panel background color to highlight the day of the calendar date.

    • setDayNames

      public void setDayNames​(java.time.DayOfWeek startDayOfWeek, java.lang.String[] dayNames)
      This method allows for the day names to be in a different language, or allows for the calendar week to start on any DayOfWeek.
      Parameters:
      startDayOfWeek - - DayOfWeek that starts the week.
      dayNames - - String array of three character weekday names.

    • setMonthNames

      public void setMonthNames​(java.lang.String[] monthNames)
      This method allows for the month names to be in a different language.
      Parameters:
      monthNames - - String array of the 12 month names, starting with January.

    • setEarliestDate

      public void setEarliestDate​(java.time.LocalDate earliestDate)
      This method sets the earliest date that the JCalendar will show. Useful for time sensitive dates like transaction dates.
      Parameters:
      earliestDate - - Earliest date that can be selected. Must be less than or equal to the calendar date specified in the constructor.

    • setLatestDate

      public void setLatestDate​(java.time.LocalDate latestDate)
      This method sets the latest date that the JCalendar will show. Useful for time sensitive dates like subscription dates.
      Parameters:
      latestDate - - Latest date that can be selected. Must be greater than or equal to the calendar date specified in the constructor.
